item.title: A Long Ride from Hell
item.description: A Long Ride from Hell, in the original Italian known as Vivo per la tua morte, is a 1968 film directed by Camillo Bazzoni. It is based on the novel Judas Gun by Gordon D. Shirreffs. The film was bodybuilder Steve Reeves' final film prior to his retirement. Reeves, who turned down the lead of A Fistful of Dollars financed and co-wrote the film himself upon seeing the successful box office returns of the Clint Eastwood spaghetti westerns at the time. The film did poorly and Reeves retired from filmmaking that year.

item.title: Roy Colt and Winchester Jack
item.description: Roy Colt & Winchester Jack is a 1970 Spaghetti Western film directed by Mario Bava.

item.title: I due figli di Ringo
item.description: Two Sons of Ringo is a 1966 Italian western-parody film. It was the last film directed by Giorgio Simonelli who, for health reasons, left the production just before the end of filming and was replaced by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: Une corde
item.description: Cemetery Without Crosses, is a 1969 Spaghetti Western film by Robert Hossein, its director, co-screenwriter and star.

item.title: Those Dirty Dogs
item.description: Those Dirty Dogs is a 1973 Italian-Spanish Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Giuseppe Rosati and starring Gianni Garko and Stephen Boyd. The film was made in the later part of the spaghetti western boom. As such it features such latter-day genre elements as self-parody, guffaw humour, near-slapstick fight scenes, machine guns hidden in everyday household items, and bombastic villains.

item.title: Brothers Blue
item.description: Blu Gang - E vissero per sempre felici e ammazzati is a 1973 Italian spaghetti western film directed by Luigi Bazzoni. For this film Tony Renis won the Nastro d'Argento for Best Score.

item.title: Drummer of Vengeance
item.description: Drummer of Vengeance is a 1971 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Mario Gariazzo and starring Ty Hardin, Rossano Brazzi and Craig Hill.

item.title: Uccidete Johnny Ringo
item.description: Uccidete Johnny Ringo, internationally released as Kill Johnny Ringo, is a 1966 Italian western film directed by Gianfranco Baldanello. It is the film debut in the spaghetti western genre for Brett Halsey.

item.title: Centomila dollari per Ringo
item.description: 100.000 dollari per Ringo is a 1965 spaghetti western film directed by Alberto De Martino.
